text: Has anyone come up with a creative solution to counter the loading delay of CTAs on a 3rd party site? Always seems to be a good 1-2 second delay on coded CTAs where the CTA loads the image fallback and then it loads the coded version. You can see an example here: <https://www.virnigmfg.com/> in the hero section with the Request a Quote and Find a Dealer CTAs.
i added some CSS ```.hs-cta-wrapper img { display: none; }``` which hides the fallback image. seems risky though.
<@UB690RZA7> are you using HubSpot’s a/b tests on any of these? If not, then I would use styled links on your ctas above the fold and just put tracking codes on them
<@U3T21PDBK> no a/b tests on any of them. that's an interesting idea. i'll present that to the team. thanks!

What i've usually done is simply css out a button and then take the ahref from the CTA embed code and use that as the link in the button, CTA's are really only hitting a tracking url so all the other stuff isnt really needed.

The rich text modules in my custom modules never allow me to edit inline. It always forces me to edit on the sidebar in the content editor.

My custom module has this rich text field
```
{% inline_rich_text field="primary_content" value="{{ module.primary_content }}" %}
````

If I drag out the native rich text module from HubSpot onto the page,
I am able to edit inline.

How can rich text editors in my custom module get that functionlity?

the complaint I am getting from others on the team is that the rich text editor on the side bar is too small and is harder to use than just editing inline.

Custom modules do not yet support the feature it’s a discussed long term plan with no ETA from HS devs.

So for now you have to edit in the edit modules pane.

Is there anway with workflows to push to a contacts timeline? It would be awesome if we were able to say "Hey, push a timeline event with the following text in it"
I'd say it might be possible through webhook but it doesnt look like that option gives you the ability to add personalization tokens to it
Hello, guys, how can i limit the post ammount in HubSpot? for example *for content in contents limit 10*
that's a setting in blog settings

If you only want to show 10 you could just add a conditional statement inside the loop

{% if loop.index < 11 %}

Talking about blogs, I found an issue happening when the Post Filter module was implemented strangely I’ve noticed that when I click on a tag the most recent blog post is not returned but all the other posts show? So, I have say 14 blogs in “Resources” and I click on that tagged category I only see 13 on return? However, when I look at the inspect code the “filter-linked-count” is showing the exact amount of blogs. Not sure where the issue is happening?
